thread.title: August 10 Deadline Set for New York Virtual Currency Firms to Apply for BitLicense
thread.title_full: August 10 Deadline Set for New York Virtual Currency Firms to Apply for BitLicense

author: BuckleySandler LLP
title: August 10 Deadline Set for New York Virtual Currency Firms to Apply for BitLicense
text:
<iframe src="http://www.jdsupra.com/post/contentViewerEmbed.aspx?fid=3d69f1ab-453b-4ba0-9bdf-cfc4ac0f6155" width="100%" height="620" frameborder="1" style="border: 2px solid #ccc; overflow-x:hidden !important; overflow:hidden;" scrolling="auto"> 
On June 24, the New York State Register published the Department of Financial Services BitLicense framework , requiring companies and individuals who provide virtual currency services involving New York or a New York Resident to apply for a BitLicense by August 8, 2015. Virtual currency firms must submit the 31-page application providing information including, among other things, (i) written policies and procedures including, but not limited to BSA/AML, cybersecurity, privacy and information security, (ii) company information, (iii) biographical information on company directors and stockholders, and (iv) an explanation of the methodology used to calculate the value of virtual currency in fiat currency. In addition, the NYDFS released a set of FAQs
